full_translation:
**The Wondrous Treasure Jade Register Abridged Text of the Three Primes’ Dignified Observances and Natural Perfection Sutra**

**Sutra Title:** *The Wondrous Treasure Jade Register Abridged Text of the Three Primes’ Dignified Observances and Natural Perfection Sutra* (abbreviated as *Jade Register Abridged Text*). Author unknown, approximately composed during the Eastern Jin or Southern Dynasties period. Among the ancient *Wondrous Treasure Scriptures*, there originally existed three scrolls: the *Upper Prime Golden Register Abridged Text* (now lost), the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text*, and the *Lower Prime Yellow Register Abridged Text*, collectively titled *The Three Primes’ Dignified Observances and Natural Perfection Sutra*. This scroll is the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* of that sutra. One fascicle. Base text from the *Daoist Canon of the Zhengtong Era*, *Wondrous Cavern Division*, *Dignified Observances* category.

---

The Heavenly Worthy said: Within the Middle Prime Palace of the Wondrous Treasure, there were originally three divisions of dignified observances totaling two thousand four hundred articles. From the era of Dragon Han to the first year of Red Clarity, the Supreme Sages compiled and edited them, extracting the essentials for practical use. Thus, eighty articles were transmitted to the perfected below who were destined for the Dao, and these are now in circulation.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In honoring the master’s dignified observances, one should burn incense. When cultivating the Dao of immortality, one must contemplate the direction of the scripture master’s abode, bowing in the heart three times, wishing that the master attain the Dao of immortality and that one’s own body ascend and transcend.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In honoring the master’s dignified observances, after contemplating the scripture master and completing the bows, next contemplate the direction of the register master’s abode, bowing in the heart three times, wishing that the master attain flying immortality and open the path for my seven generations of ancestors and parents to swiftly ascend to the heavenly halls, and that I, having attained the perfected Dao, ascend into the formless.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In honoring the master’s dignified observances, after contemplating the register master, next contemplate the direction of the deliverance master’s abode, bowing in the heart three times, wishing that the master ascend and transcend, attaining the rank of lofty immortality, and open the path for me through the five sufferings and eight difficulties, that my name be entered into the immortal register, and that I forever become a perfected person.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In honoring the master’s dignified observances, the scripture master is the origin of the scriptures, and thus one should perform rites to the Three Treasures’ origin. The register master is the master of masters, and thus one should perform rites to the registers of life and death. The deliverance master is the master who transmits the scriptures and delivers me from the five paths of difficulty, and thus rites should be performed. One who studies without revering the three masters will find the Three Treasures unyielding, the Three Realms disrespectful, and demonic spirits harming the body.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In honoring the scripture master’s dignified observances, when greeting the scripture master, one should address them as, “Disciple so-and-so, with trepidation, speaks after,” then bow again with trepidation.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In honoring the register master’s dignified observances, when greeting the register master, one should address them as, “Recorded disciple so-and-so, with reverence, speaks after,” then bow again with reverence.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In honoring the deliverance master’s dignified observances, when greeting the deliverance master, one should address them as, “Fully recorded disciple so-and-so speaks after,” then bow again.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the master’s dignified observances when responding to the disciple, one should address them by name, then say, “With respect, I express my gratitude.”

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In honoring the master’s dignified observances, when speaking with the master, one should always address them as, “Disciple so-and-so respectfully states,” and not simply as “disciple.”

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In honoring the master’s dignified observances, when a male official speaks with the master, they should address themselves by name and not as “disciple of the surname.”

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In honoring the master’s dignified observances, when a female official speaks with the master, they should address themselves by name and not simply as “disciple of the surname.”

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In honoring the master’s dignified observances, when making a request or inquiring about matters of the Dao, one should first bow once to the scripture master and the master, then bow again to the deliverance master and state one’s case.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should fast and purify oneself the night before, don the proper ritual attire, stand solemnly and reverently at dawn, and proceed with both urgency and joy.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should correct one’s posture while walking, bowing with head lowered and raised, maintaining a composed and orderly demeanor, and joyfully facing the divine.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should always tread lightly, hands clasped, mindful of the Supreme Perfected.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should always focus the mind on reverent cultivation, hands respectfully clasped, thoughts clear and distinct.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should concentrate the mind, rectify oneself, and maintain a reverent and solemn attitude in bowing, moving and stopping with calm composure.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, in bowing and yielding, one should venerate the non-action, delight in the mysterious void, and welcome the arrival of joy and felicity.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should wash the hands and feet, wear clean and plain clothing, anoint the body with fragrance, and harmonize one’s qi with the divine radiance.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, when performing rites and greetings, one should enter the purification hall, burn incense and make vows, and pay homage to the Three Treasures.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should don the ritual attire, arrange the sequence of left and right, listen and contemplate with focused attention, and respond appropriately both internally and externally.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should be filled with joy, maintain a serious expression, gaze directly, and stand in awe and reverence, as if treading on thin ice.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should sit upright with hands clasped, maintaining a dignified and flawless demeanor for all to observe.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, after completing the rites, one should reflect on one’s own life, the transgressions committed, and resolve to rouse and discipline oneself.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, after completing the reflection on one’s transgressions, one should calmly contemplate clarity and emptiness, focusing the mind on the spirit and qi, ensuring they are never far apart.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, after completing all reflections, one should rise to sweep and purify the inner and outer spaces, offering diligent service and demonstrating reverence.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, when bowing in respect, one should rise to perform the rites, then return to one’s seat and present one’s thoughts.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should regulate one’s voice and breath, exhaling and inhaling gently, never allowing harshness or rigidity, lest it harm the true qi.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should choose words with care, speaking in accordance with the Dharma’s tone, never speaking lightly or recklessly, nor indulging in private or vulgar matters.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should diligently follow the upright Way, never wandering astray or wavering in resolve.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, men and women should each maintain their proper place, never advancing or retreating in a manner that causes delay or discord.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, men and women should maintain solemnity, never lowering their heads to whisper or engaging in lewd glances.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, when making requests or inquiries, one should report matters as they arise, never evading or secretly taking what is not given.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should bring provisions for oneself, never burdening the master’s household with endless demands.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should maintain a refined and orderly demeanor, never allowing filth or negligence in the inner or outer spaces.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should rectify oneself in pursuit of the true, never harboring duplicity or turning away with divided attention.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should keep the mind and mouth pure, focusing on the true and upright, never consuming alcohol, which muddles the spirit and qi.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should attend to matters with reverence and caution, never boasting of teachings or falsely invoking spirits to deceive the ignorant.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should maintain a composed expression and speak with care, never engaging in jest or mutual mockery.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should receive and attend with upright reverence, never sitting askew, leaning, or resting one’s elbows.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should proceed directly to and from, never lingering or wandering aimlessly.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, when the master poses a question, one should bow with hands clasped to the ground, state one’s name, and respond respectfully.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should uphold the precepts with self-discipline, remaining steadfast unto death, never indulging in杂念 or seeking worldly glory amid the dust and defilement.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should ensure that those of like mind and spirit maintain harmony in body and heart, never broadly recruiting those of dissimilar nature.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, when resting or sleeping, one should wear proper attire, focusing the mind on the true and settling the spirit, never undressing or exposing the body.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, when rising, resting, or moving, one should walk with measured steps, never acting harshly or rushing about in a manner that startles others.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should keep one’s headwear and sashes neatly arranged, never exposing the head or showing disrespect to the venerable.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should maintain a heart filled with awe and joy, as if in the presence of a great sage, never giving way to anger or resentment toward others.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should remain joyful and auspicious, never voicing complaints, weeping, or indulging in self-pity.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should observe proper etiquette in bowing, yielding, advancing, and retreating, never allowing strength or weakness to dictate interactions without reverence.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should cultivate loyalty, filial piety, benevolence, and steadfast righteousness, never harboring jealousy or embracing unrighteousness.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should conceal faults and promote virtue, always guiding others, never slandering or suppressing the ignorant.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should strive to enlighten and broadly deliver all beings, never closing off or obstructing the ignorant.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should awaken the ignorant and guide them into the Dharma gate, never concealing the Way or obscuring the true to seek personal merit.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should aspire for all under heaven to behold the Dharma gate, never harboring divergent thoughts or dwelling on deviant paths.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should reflect on the master’s household, that all may attain flight and transcendence, with oneself as an attendant, ascending to the ranks of the great sages.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should inquire about the precepts and disciplines, never peering or prying to expose the scriptures.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should focus on a single matter, never acting arrogantly or playing with the master’s robes and belongings, nor opening and inspecting chests and boxes.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should carry paper on one’s person and never take the master’s brushes and ink for personal use.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should inquire about the scriptures and precepts, reverently upholding their secrecy and weight, never recklessly disseminating them, nor seeking fame and virtue.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, when with fellow disciples, one should mutually instruct and guide, never harboring envy, obstruction, or strife, nor contending to exalt oneself.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Tallies Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, upon seeing others’ errors or incomprehension, one should immediately enlighten and instruct them, making known their faults and transgressions, never mocking or observing their successes and failures.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, when the master is absent, one should bow in the oratory as if in the presence of a revered elder, never departing directly.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should maintain solemnity within and without, never inscribing or drawing on the walls and pillars of the oratory.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should approach with plain attire and soft footsteps, never wielding blades or staves, nor discussing martial affairs.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should abide in humility and deference, practicing reverence, frugality, and yielding, never acting on one’s own whim, nor boasting of oneself and envying others.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Tallies Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of serving the master, one should always pay respects morning and evening, attending to their movements and stillness, maintaining a gentle countenance as if honoring one’s lord and father.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of serving the master, when apart from the master’s side, one should always pay respects morning and evening, bowing from afar with heartfelt reverence, eyes fixed and mind devoted, as if in the presence of a revered elder.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of serving the master, when the master experiences joyous occasions, all disciples should rejoice wholeheartedly, their delight intermingling, as the Dao’s accomplishments flourish and boundless blessings descend.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of serving the master, when the master bears sorrow and grief, all disciples should share in their distress, moving and resting without ease.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of serving the master, when the master suffers illness or hardship, all disciples should attend closely at their side, tending to their breath as if to one’s own parents.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Tallies Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of serving the master, when the master faces calamity or misfortune, all disciples should lead fellow disciples in establishing oratories and offering prayers to accumulate merit and virtue.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Tallies Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of being a master, one should aspire to enlighten and transform the four directions, guiding all to return to the source, that the teachings of the Dao may spread far and wide, universally accomplishing the Way, with virtue flowing downward, and the lineage of disciples flourishing.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of being a master, one should wish for disciples to receive teachings with clarity, their studies and wisdom advancing daily in accomplishment.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of being a master, when disciples submit sincerely, one should redouble earnest encouragement, wishing for their swift attainment of accomplishment, early liberation from the prison of worldly attachments, and ascension to the ranks of the great sages.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Tallies Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of being a master, when disciples devote their hearts with utmost sincerity, the master should fast and reflect, aligning inner and outer, leaving nothing concealed.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of being a master, when disciples fall short, one should intensify instruction and discipline, rigorously upholding the teachings of the Dao, treating them as one’s own children.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of being a master, when disciples experience joyous occasions, the master should rejoice and offer wishes, that the Dao may be accomplished and virtue flourish, with boundless blessings flowing forth.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of being a master, when disciples bear sorrow, the master should console and receive them, keeping them in mind morning and evening as if they were one’s own.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of being a master, when disciples face calamity or illness, the master should establish oratories, offering prayers morning and evening to accumulate merit and virtue, delivering them from disaster and suffering.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of being a master, when expounding and disseminating the transformative teachings of the Dao, one should ensure that all four ranks of disciples are treated equally, their hearts and minds unified without harboring duplicity.

The Heavenly Worthy addressed the Most High Lord of the Great Dao, saying: The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Jade Register Abridged Text of the Middle Prime Palace of the Cavernous Mystery Numinous Treasure* originally comprised three parts—Upper Prime, Middle Prime, and Lower Prime—each containing eight hundred articles on dignified observances, totaling two thousand four hundred articles across the three parts. All were inscribed in gold and jade characters, and the Left Duke of the Immortals’ Capital compiled them in the Middle Prime Palace. After the Dragon Han era, they sank into chaos, their texts altered and largely incomplete. In the first year of the Vermilion Brightness, the Supreme Sages edited and collated them, extracting essentials into eighty articles per part, totaling two hundred forty articles across the three parts, which were then concealed in the Three Prime Palaces. Two hundred forty Jade Maidens of the Golden Dawn and two hundred forty Golden Lads of the Jade Morn were assigned to burn incense and attend the scriptures, inspecting for omissions and negligence. According to the mysterious statutes, they are transmitted once every forty thousand kalpas. When divine perfected beings descend to teach, the cycle of transmission is accelerated, requiring true persons to descend and instruct the world every four hundred years, with permission granted for three transmissions within forty years. If the allotted time is not fulfilled and the numinous texts are lightly disseminated, one’s seven ancestors will be imprisoned in hell, bearing the wind’s blades for ten thousand kalpas without release.

The Heavenly Worthy said: Natural dignified observances are the bearing of all heavens and the ritual standards of perfected beings. Those who behold them possess the karmic conditions of a hundred million kalpas, their former lives having borne names inscribed on golden tablets and jade registers, destined for transcendence among the ranks of divine immortals. Thus, they encounter these texts to fulfill their authenticity. Those who cultivate them will ride dragon chariots and ascend at dawn; those who uphold them will enable their seven ancestors to depart hell and ascend to heaven, roaming freely in the Jade Immortals’ Palace of the Middle Prime, where gates and households remain serene, untouched by the ten thousand calamities, revered by the three realms, and attended by the ten thousand spirits at their gates.

The Dao is most revered and noble—it ought to be kept sacred and concealed.

The Most High bows in reverence, offering obeisance to receive these essential words.

Here ends *The Wondrous Scripture of the Three Primes’ Dignified Observances: The Authentic Classic of the Dao’s Spontaneous Majesty from the Cavernous Mystery, Numinous Treasure, and Jade Registers of Simplified Texts*.

chunks.original_text: 洞玄灵宝玉箓简文三元威仪自然真经 经名：洞玄灵宝玉箓简文三元威仪自然真经。 简称《玉录简文》。 撰人不详，约出於东晋南朝。 古《灵宝经》中原有上元金录简文（已佚）、中元玉录简文、下元黄录简文各一篇，合称《三元威仪自然真经》。 本篇即该经《中元玉录简文》。 一卷。 底本出处：《正统道藏》洞玄部威仪类。 洞玄灵宝玉箓简文三元威仪自然真经 天尊曰：灵宝中元宫中，旧有三部威仪二千四百条，自经龙汉之后，至赤明元年，上圣撰校，抄集要用，使下教真人应得道者，凡八十条，而今行焉。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：奉师威仪，宜烧香。 凡修仙道，当思经师所在之方，心拜三过，愿师得仙道，我身升度。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：奉师威仪，思经师，礼拜毕，次思籍师所在之方，心拜三过，愿师得飞仙，为我开度七祖父母，早升天堂，我得道真，升入无形。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：奉师威仪，思籍师毕，次思度师所在之方，心拜三过，愿念师得升度，上登高仙，为我开度五苦八难，名入仙录，永成真人。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：奉师威仪，经师则经之始，故宜设礼三宝之宗。 籍师则师之师，故宜设礼生死录籍。 所曰度师则受经之师，度我五道之难，故应设礼。 为学不尊三师，则三宝不降，三界不敬，鬼魔害身。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：奉经师威仪，问讯经师，上称弟子某甲，惶恐言后，惶恐再拜。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：奉籍师威仪，问讯籍师，上称曰记弟子某甲稽首后，稽首再拜言。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：奉度师威仪，问讯度师，上称具记弟子某甲言后，再拜言。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：师答弟子威仪。 当称名，上谢后言敬谢。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：奉师威仪，与师言，皆当称弟子某甲启，不得但称弟子。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：奉师威仪，男官与师言，皆称名不得称姓弟子也。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：奉师威仪，女官与师言，皆称名言，不得但称姓弟子也。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：奉师威仪，有所请求，规问法事，当先礼经师、师，各一拜毕，再拜启度师而自陈。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当宿昔斋戒，严装法服，端恭待旦，载驰载欣。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当正己趋行，稽首俯仰，安徐容序，欢然对神。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，每当重掌累足，警行敛手，心存上真。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，每当一心恭修礼敬，敛手信礼，注念分明。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当专心正已，意志玄虚，恭肃礼拜，动止安徐。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，揖让礼拜，崇向无为，惧乐玄虚，喜庆交至。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当澡洗手足，衣服洁素，体有香熏，气合神景。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，施礼问讯当，入斋堂，烧香愿念，礼於三宝。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当施法服，科次左右，端详听思，中外应承。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当振喜交集，正颜直视，祇畏悚息，如履薄冰。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当执手平坐，俨然无亏，为众所观。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当修礼既毕，当思己身，受生所犯，念自举励。

**The Wondrous Treasure Jade Register Abridged Text of the Three Primes’ Dignified Observances and Natural Perfection Sutra**

**Sutra Title:** *The Wondrous Treasure Jade Register Abridged Text of the Three Primes’ Dignified Observances and Natural Perfection Sutra* (abbreviated as *Jade Register Abridged Text*). Author unknown, approximately composed during the Eastern Jin or Southern Dynasties period. Among the ancient *Wondrous Treasure Scriptures*, there originally existed three scrolls: the *Upper Prime Golden Register Abridged Text* (now lost), the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text*, and the *Lower Prime Yellow Register Abridged Text*, collectively titled *The Three Primes’ Dignified Observances and Natural Perfection Sutra*. This scroll is the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* of that sutra. One fascicle. Base text from the *Daoist Canon of the Zhengtong Era*, *Wondrous Cavern Division*, *Dignified Observances* category.

---

The Heavenly Worthy said: Within the Middle Prime Palace of the Wondrous Treasure, there were originally three divisions of dignified observances totaling two thousand four hundred articles. From the era of Dragon Han to the first year of Red Clarity, the Supreme Sages compiled and edited them, extracting the essentials for practical use. Thus, eighty articles were transmitted to the perfected below who were destined for the Dao, and these are now in circulation.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In honoring the master’s dignified observances, one should burn incense. When cultivating the Dao of immortality, one must contemplate the direction of the scripture master’s abode, bowing in the heart three times, wishing that the master attain the Dao of immortality and that one’s own body ascend and transcend.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In honoring the master’s dignified observances, after contemplating the scripture master and completing the bows, next contemplate the direction of the register master’s abode, bowing in the heart three times, wishing that the master attain flying immortality and open the path for my seven generations of ancestors and parents to swiftly ascend to the heavenly halls, and that I, having attained the perfected Dao, ascend into the formless.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In honoring the master’s dignified observances, after contemplating the register master, next contemplate the direction of the deliverance master’s abode, bowing in the heart three times, wishing that the master ascend and transcend, attaining the rank of lofty immortality, and open the path for me through the five sufferings and eight difficulties, that my name be entered into the immortal register, and that I forever become a perfected person.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In honoring the master’s dignified observances, the scripture master is the origin of the scriptures, and thus one should perform rites to the Three Treasures’ origin. The register master is the master of masters, and thus one should perform rites to the registers of life and death. The deliverance master is the master who transmits the scriptures and delivers me from the five paths of difficulty, and thus rites should be performed. One who studies without revering the three masters will find the Three Treasures unyielding, the Three Realms disrespectful, and demonic spirits harming the body.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In honoring the scripture master’s dignified observances, when greeting the scripture master, one should address them as, “Disciple so-and-so, with trepidation, speaks after,” then bow again with trepidation.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In honoring the register master’s dignified observances, when greeting the register master, one should address them as, “Recorded disciple so-and-so, with reverence, speaks after,” then bow again with reverence.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In honoring the deliverance master’s dignified observances, when greeting the deliverance master, one should address them as, “Fully recorded disciple so-and-so speaks after,” then bow again.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the master’s dignified observances when responding to the disciple, one should address them by name, then say, “With respect, I express my gratitude.”

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In honoring the master’s dignified observances, when speaking with the master, one should always address them as, “Disciple so-and-so respectfully states,” and not simply as “disciple.”

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In honoring the master’s dignified observances, when a male official speaks with the master, they should address themselves by name and not as “disciple of the surname.”

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In honoring the master’s dignified observances, when a female official speaks with the master, they should address themselves by name and not simply as “disciple of the surname.”

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In honoring the master’s dignified observances, when making a request or inquiring about matters of the Dao, one should first bow once to the scripture master and the master, then bow again to the deliverance master and state one’s case.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should fast and purify oneself the night before, don the proper ritual attire, stand solemnly and reverently at dawn, and proceed with both urgency and joy.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should correct one’s posture while walking, bowing with head lowered and raised, maintaining a composed and orderly demeanor, and joyfully facing the divine.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should always tread lightly, hands clasped, mindful of the Supreme Perfected.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should always focus the mind on reverent cultivation, hands respectfully clasped, thoughts clear and distinct.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should concentrate the mind, rectify oneself, and maintain a reverent and solemn attitude in bowing, moving and stopping with calm composure.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, in bowing and yielding, one should venerate the non-action, delight in the mysterious void, and welcome the arrival of joy and felicity.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should wash the hands and feet, wear clean and plain clothing, anoint the body with fragrance, and harmonize one’s qi with the divine radiance.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, when performing rites and greetings, one should enter the purification hall, burn incense and make vows, and pay homage to the Three Treasures.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should don the ritual attire, arrange the sequence of left and right, listen and contemplate with focused attention, and respond appropriately both internally and externally.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should be filled with joy, maintain a serious expression, gaze directly, and stand in awe and reverence, as if treading on thin ice.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should sit upright with hands clasped, maintaining a dignified and flawless demeanor for all to observe.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, after completing the rites, one should reflect on one’s own life, the transgressions committed, and resolve to rouse and discipline oneself.

chunks.original_text: 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，念罪既毕，静思清虚，存念神气，不相远离。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，诸念既毕，当起扫洒内外，奉宣功勤，效於恭敬。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，有所稽颗，当起施礼，然后还坐，陈启所心。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当安徐声气，吐纳柔和，勿得高刚， 伤作真气。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当择言而道，言以法音，勿得轻忽，妄及私鄙。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当勤行直道，勿得游过，彷徨二心。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当男女各道，勿得前却，迟速相牵。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，男女整肃，勿得低头耳语，淫视相当。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，有所启索，随事以闻，勿得避回，私自窃取。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当赍粮自随，勿得烦损师门，求取无厌。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当修整为意，勿得粪草，秽慢内外。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当正己求真，勿得怀挟，背向不专。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当清虚心口，以注正真，勿得饮酒，浊乱神气。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当恭慎正事，勿得称道传教，假因精祟，迷於愚短。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当整颜慎言，勿得调笑，更相戏弄。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当端恭承奉，勿得侧坐，抵卧肘隐。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当直造往反，勿得攀牵，彷徨游扬。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，师有所问，当敛板伏地，称名上对。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当持戒自检，守死不移，勿得杂念，荣务尘浊。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当令同气，形心齐平，勿广招引，异类之人。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，宿正卧息，当着衣服，思真安定，勿得解脱，裸身露形。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，卧息起止，当涉履徐步，勿得狠戾，奔走惊骇。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，冠带巾帻，每令整顿，勿得露头，轻慢尊贵。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当惧心欣喜，如对大圣，勿得瞋怒，忿恚四辈。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当欣欣吉庆，勿得称怨，悲泣自悼。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当修礼节，揖让进退，勿得强弱相承，无有尊敬。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当念施忠孝，仁慈笃义，勿行嫉妬，怀抱不道。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当藏恶宣善，每引四辈，勿得毁谤，抑遏顽短。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当思开化，广度天人，勿得闭匿，遏塞顽人。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当开悟愚短，令入法门，勿得蔽道隐真，自取功名。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当念普天，同见法门，勿得异念，存想邪径。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当念师家，普得飞行，身得侍从，上登大圣。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当请问科戒，勿得阚窥，发泄经书。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当注一事，勿得傲戏，弄师服玩，开看箱箧。

chunks.original_text: 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当赍纸自随，勿得辄取师家笔墨，以供己用。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当请问经戒，尊承秘重，勿妄宣传，要取名德。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当与同学，共相教度，勿得＠妬鬲戾，争竟称己。 中元玉筹简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，见人谬误，有所不达，当即开示，令知罪失，勿得哂笑，观其成败。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，师行不在，当礼拜斋堂，如见尊长，勿得径去。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当整肃内外，勿得书画，斋堂壁柱。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当素身蹑履，勿得操持刀杖，论及武事。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：诣师威仪，当谦下自居，恭俭逊让，勿自造意，称己嫉人。 中元玉筹简文神仙品曰：奉师威仪，常当朝瞑礼问，动静承奉，温颜如敬君父。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：奉师威仪，离师左右，常当朝瞑，遥心礼拜，目存心恭，如对尊长。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：奉师威仪，师有吉庆，弟子皆当一心欣欣，欢喜交集，道成功就，福覆无极。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：奉师威仪，师有哀忧，弟子皆当心抱忧戚，出入无巏。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：奉师威仪，师有疾苦，弟子皆当侍近左右，亲亲气息，有如父母。 中元玉筹简文神仙品曰：奉师威仪，师有灾厄，弟子皆当率诸同学，建斋祈请，以立功德。 中元玉筹简文神仙品曰：为师威仪，当愿开化四方归宗，法教广远，普天成就，德流自下，门徒兴隆。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：为师威仪，当愿弟子受教聪明，学业智慧，意志日成。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：为师威仪，弟子归情，当加诚励，愿得成就，早出爱狱，上登大圣。 中元玉等简文神仙品曰：为师威仪，弟子归心，情丹意尽，师当斋思，内外相应，无所容隐。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：为师威仪，弟子不及，当加训厉，严整法教，有过儿子。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：为师威仪，弟子有庆，师当欣愿，道成德隆，福流无极。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：为师威仪，弟子有忧，师当慰接，晨夕系心，有若一己。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：为师威仪，弟子厄疾，师当建斋，晨夕祈请，以立功德，拔度灾患。 中元玉箓简文神仙品曰：为师威仪，敷宣法化，当令弟子四辈平等，齐同心腹一无怀贰意。 天尊告太上大道君曰：洞玄灵宝中元宫中玉箓简文神仙品目，旧有上元、　　中元、下元三部威仪，部有八百条，三部合二千四百条。 皆金书玉字，仙都左公总录於中元宫中。 自经龙汉之后，沦於混沌，其文改易，多不全旧。 至赤明元年，上圣撰校，抄集要用，部有八十条，三部合二百四十条，秘於三元宫中。 以玉华之女、金晨玉童各二百四十人，烧香侍经，检录漏慢。 依玄科四万劫一传。 神真下教，运度促急，道须真人四百年下世教化，四十年中听令三传。 年限未充，轻宣灵文，七祖囚於地狱，身负风刀，万劫无原。 天尊言：自然威仪，诸天之俯仰，真人之仪轨，得盻之者，皆亿劫因缘，先身宿有金简玉名，神仙品中，应得仙度，故见其文，以成其真。 修之者则驰骋龙驾，白日登晨，奉之者七祖即得去离地狱，上升天堂，逍遥中元玉仙宫中，门户清肃，万灾不干，三界敬护，万神朝门。

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should carry paper on one’s person and never take the master’s brushes and ink for personal use.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should inquire about the scriptures and precepts, reverently upholding their secrecy and weight, never recklessly disseminating them, nor seeking fame and virtue.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, when with fellow disciples, one should mutually instruct and guide, never harboring envy, obstruction, or strife, nor contending to exalt oneself.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Tallies Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, upon seeing others’ errors or incomprehension, one should immediately enlighten and instruct them, making known their faults and transgressions, never mocking or observing their successes and failures.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, when the master is absent, one should bow in the oratory as if in the presence of a revered elder, never departing directly.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should maintain solemnity within and without, never inscribing or drawing on the walls and pillars of the oratory.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should approach with plain attire and soft footsteps, never wielding blades or staves, nor discussing martial affairs.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of visiting the master, one should abide in humility and deference, practicing reverence, frugality, and yielding, never acting on one’s own whim, nor boasting of oneself and envying others.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Tallies Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of serving the master, one should always pay respects morning and evening, attending to their movements and stillness, maintaining a gentle countenance as if honoring one’s lord and father.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of serving the master, when apart from the master’s side, one should always pay respects morning and evening, bowing from afar with heartfelt reverence, eyes fixed and mind devoted, as if in the presence of a revered elder.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of serving the master, when the master experiences joyous occasions, all disciples should rejoice wholeheartedly, their delight intermingling, as the Dao’s accomplishments flourish and boundless blessings descend.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of serving the master, when the master bears sorrow and grief, all disciples should share in their distress, moving and resting without ease.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of serving the master, when the master suffers illness or hardship, all disciples should attend closely at their side, tending to their breath as if to one’s own parents.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Tallies Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of serving the master, when the master faces calamity or misfortune, all disciples should lead fellow disciples in establishing oratories and offering prayers to accumulate merit and virtue.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Tallies Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of being a master, one should aspire to enlighten and transform the four directions, guiding all to return to the source, that the teachings of the Dao may spread far and wide, universally accomplishing the Way, with virtue flowing downward, and the lineage of disciples flourishing.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of being a master, one should wish for disciples to receive teachings with clarity, their studies and wisdom advancing daily in accomplishment.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of being a master, when disciples submit sincerely, one should redouble earnest encouragement, wishing for their swift attainment of accomplishment, early liberation from the prison of worldly attachments, and ascension to the ranks of the great sages.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Tallies Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of being a master, when disciples devote their hearts with utmost sincerity, the master should fast and reflect, aligning inner and outer, leaving nothing concealed.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of being a master, when disciples fall short, one should intensify instruction and discipline, rigorously upholding the teachings of the Dao, treating them as one’s own children.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of being a master, when disciples experience joyous occasions, the master should rejoice and offer wishes, that the Dao may be accomplished and virtue flourish, with boundless blessings flowing forth.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of being a master, when disciples bear sorrow, the master should console and receive them, keeping them in mind morning and evening as if they were one’s own.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of being a master, when disciples face calamity or illness, the master should establish oratories, offering prayers morning and evening to accumulate merit and virtue, delivering them from disaster and suffering.

The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Middle Prime Jade Register Abridged Text* states: In the dignified observances of being a master, when expounding and disseminating the transformative teachings of the Dao, one should ensure that all four ranks of disciples are treated equally, their hearts and minds unified without harboring duplicity.

The Heavenly Worthy addressed the Most High Lord of the Great Dao, saying: The *Divine Immortals* section of the *Jade Register Abridged Text of the Middle Prime Palace of the Cavernous Mystery Numinous Treasure* originally comprised three parts—Upper Prime, Middle Prime, and Lower Prime—each containing eight hundred articles on dignified observances, totaling two thousand four hundred articles across the three parts. All were inscribed in gold and jade characters, and the Left Duke of the Immortals’ Capital compiled them in the Middle Prime Palace. After the Dragon Han era, they sank into chaos, their texts altered and largely incomplete. In the first year of the Vermilion Brightness, the Supreme Sages edited and collated them, extracting essentials into eighty articles per part, totaling two hundred forty articles across the three parts, which were then concealed in the Three Prime Palaces. Two hundred forty Jade Maidens of the Golden Dawn and two hundred forty Golden Lads of the Jade Morn were assigned to burn incense and attend the scriptures, inspecting for omissions and negligence. According to the mysterious statutes, they are transmitted once every forty thousand kalpas. When divine perfected beings descend to teach, the cycle of transmission is accelerated, requiring true persons to descend and instruct the world every four hundred years, with permission granted for three transmissions within forty years. If the allotted time is not fulfilled and the numinous texts are lightly disseminated, one’s seven ancestors will be imprisoned in hell, bearing the wind’s blades for ten thousand kalpas without release.

The Heavenly Worthy said: Natural dignified observances are the bearing of all heavens and the ritual standards of perfected beings. Those who behold them possess the karmic conditions of a hundred million kalpas, their former lives having borne names inscribed on golden tablets and jade registers, destined for transcendence among the ranks of divine immortals. Thus, they encounter these texts to fulfill their authenticity. Those who cultivate them will ride dragon chariots and ascend at dawn; those who uphold them will enable their seven ancestors to depart hell and ascend to heaven, roaming freely in the Jade Immortals’ Palace of the Middle Prime, where gates and households remain serene, untouched by the ten thousand calamities, revered by the three realms, and attended by the ten thousand spirits at their gates.
